messages.subject: Re:hslda and NHEN
messages.msgSnippet: NHEN (nhen.org) has developed as another source of information for themedia about homeschooling.  It includes people of every stripe, including HSLDA members.
messages.messageBody:
NHEN (nhen.org) has developed as another source of information for themedia
about homeschooling. It includes people of every stripe, including HSLDA
members.


> The National Home Education Network exists to encourage and facilitate the
> vital grassroots work of state and localÂ  homeschooling groups and
> individuals by providing information, fostering networking and promoting
> public relations on a national level. Because we believe there is strength
> in a diverse network of homeschoolers, we support the freedom of all
> individual families to choose home education and to direct such education.
>



<A HREF="http://www.nhen.org/">Welcome To the National Home Education Network</A>

Re: HSLDA
From the HSLDA application:
BY SIGNING THIS APPLICATION, WE AGREE:
[snip]2 . To use a clearly organized program of education to instruct
ourchildren.[snip]
I think that pretty much eliminates unschoolers. You are also asked to
list the hours of instruction. Here is the link if you want to view the
whole application!:
<A HREF="http://www.hslda.org/join/tour5.asp">http://www.hslda.org/join/tour5.asp</A>

I understand from another list I am on that they have refused unschoolers in
the past.
Renee



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
